sentence.text: MicroRNAs (protein polyubiquitinationNAs) are identified as key regulators in cancer initiation, progression and metastasis including gastric cancer (GC).
Furthermore, lower protein polyubiquitination-129-5p expression closely associated with tumor size and lymph node invasion and poor prognosis of GC patients.
In vivo, upregulation of protein polyubiquitination-129-5p also inhibited tumor growth.
Therefore, these results indicated that protein polyubiquitination-129-5p functioned as a tumor suppressor in GC and may be a potential target of GC treatment
